elements.name: arcgis-area-measurement-2d
elements.description:
The Area Measurement 2D component calculates and displays the area and perimeter of a polygon only in a [MapView](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html).
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `clear(): Promise<void>` - Clear the current measurement.
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `start(): Promise<void>` - Starts a new measurement.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-area-measurement-2d/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.description:

Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

[Read more...](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-AreaMeasurement2D.html#unit)

elements.name: arcgis-area-measurement-3d
elements.description:
The Area Measurement 3D component can be added to a [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/)
component to calculate and display area and perimeter of polygons.

[![measurement-area-3d](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/3D_AreaMeasurement_widget.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/measurement-3d/)

How the area and perimeter are computed depends on the scene's spatial reference and the length of the measured perimeter.

In **geographic coordinate systems** (GCS) and in **Web Mercator**:
- If the measurement's perimeter is below 100 km, they are computed in a Euclidean manner,
  in an [ECEF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECEF) coordinate system (or equivalent on other planets).
- If the perimeter is above 100 km, they are computed geodetically, and the visualization takes
  the curvature of the planet into consideration.

In **projected coordinate systems** (PCS), apart from Web Mercator, the area and perimeter
are always calculated in a Euclidean manner (in their respective PCS).

The area may be visualized and calculated in two ways:
1. If all the vertices are mostly coplanar (lying on the same plane),
   the measurement polygon is formed on that plane, and area and perimeter are calculated from its geometry.
2. If the vertices don't form a planar surface, the measurement polygon
   is projected to a horizontal plane, and area and perimeter are calculated from its geometry.

![area-measurement-3d-types](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/area-measurement-3d-types.png)

When the component is active, a horizontal "laser" line is drawn which indicates the height at the current mouse position.
This line can help in analyzing the heights of objects relative to each other and the terrain.

**Things to consider**

* Area Measurement 3D is designed to work in the Scene component. For measurements in the [Map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-map/)
component, use [Area Measurement 2D](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-area-measurement-2d/).
* Snapping is enabled by default. Holding the `CTRL` key disables it.
* Layer types currently supported for snapping are:
[FeatureLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-FeatureLayer.html),
[GraphicsLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-GraphicsLayer.html) (except Mesh geometries),
[GeoJSONLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-GeoJSONLayer.html),
[WFSLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-WFSLayer.html),
[CSVLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-CSVLayer.html),
[3D Object SceneLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-SceneLayer.html),
and [BuildingSceneLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-BuildingSceneLayer.html).

**See also**

- [AreaMeasurementAnalysis](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-AreaMeasurementAnalysis.html)
- [Sample - Measurement in 3D](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/measurement-3d/)
- [Sample - Analysis objects](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/analysis-objects/)
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `clear(): Promise<void>` - Clears the current measurement.
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `start(): Promise<void>` - Starts a new measurement.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-area-measurement-3d/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Icon which represents the component.
Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The component's default label.

attributes.name: reference-element
attributes.description: By assigning the `id` attribute of the Map or Scene component to this property, you can position a child component anywhere in the DOM while still maintaining a connection to the Map or Scene.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description:
The component's state. The values mean the following:

* `disabled` -  not ready yet
* `ready` - ready for measuring
* `measuring` - currently measuring
* `measured` - measuring has finished

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description:
Unit system (imperial, metric) or specific unit used for displaying the area values. Possible values are listed in
[unitOptions](#unitOptions).

properties.name: unitOptions
properties.description:
List of available units and unit systems (imperial, metric) that are shown in the component's dropdown.
By default, the following units are included: `metric`, `imperial`, `square-inches`, `square-feet`, `square-us-feet`, `square-yards`, `square-miles`, `square-meters`, `square-kilometers`, `acres`, `ares`, `hectares`.
Possible [unit](#unit) values can only be a subset of this list.

elements.name: arcgis-basemap-gallery
elements.description:
The Basemap Gallery component displays a collection images representing basemaps from [ArcGIS.com](https://www.arcgis.com/index.html) or a user-defined set of map or image services. When a new basemap is selected from the Basemap Gallery, the map's basemap layers are removed and replaced with the basemap layers of the associated basemap selected in the gallery.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.

elements.name: arcgis-basemap-layer-list
elements.description:
The Basemap Layer List component provides a way to display a list of [Basemap](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Basemap.html) layers and switch on/off their visibility. [Base layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Basemap.html#baseLayers) and [reference layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Basemap.html#referenceLayers) are divided into separate sections. When editing is enabled, layers can be reordered by dragging and dropping between the lists and the title can be edited.
--

### Events
- **arcgisClose** - Emitted when the component's close button is clicked.
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisTriggerAction** - Emitted when an action is triggered on the component.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.

elements.name: arcgis-basemap-toggle
elements.description:
The Basemap Toggle component allows an end-user to switch between two basemaps.

The basemaps can have different spatial references.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `toggle(): Promise<any>` - Toggles to the [next basemap](#nextBasemap).

elements.name: arcgis-bookmarks
elements.description:
The Bookmarks component allow end users to quickly navigate to a particular area of interest. It displays a list of [bookmarks](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-webmap-Bookmark.html), which are typically defined inside the [WebMap](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebMap.html#bookmarks).
--

elements.name: arcgis-building-explorer
elements.description:
The Building Explorer component is used to filter and explore the various components of [BuildingSceneLayers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-BuildingSceneLayer.html). BuildingSceneLayers are complex digital models of buildings and interiors and can contain thousands of components grouped in sublayers. Using this component, buildings can be filtered by level, construction phase or by disciplines and categories.

**Known limitations**

Building Explorer is only supported in a 3D [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/) component.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.

prevent memory leaks.

* `ready` - component is ready
* `failed` - component failed to load data

elements.name: arcgis-coordinate-conversion
elements.description:
The Coordinate Conversion component provides a way to display user cursor position either as map coordinates or as any of several popular coordinate notations. Additionally, the component provides a way to convert user input coordinates into a [Point](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-geometry-Point.html).
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `reverseConvert(coordinate: string, format: __esri.Format): Promise<__esri.Point | nullish>`

prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-daylight
elements.description:
The Daylight component can be used to manipulate the lighting conditions of a [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/).

**Known limitations**

Daylight is only supported in a 3D [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/) component.

**See also**

- [Environment](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/#environment)
- [Sample - Daylight component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/daylight/)
--

### Events
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisUserDateTimeChange** - Fires when the user changes the date or time in the component by interacting with the slider, the date picker, the
season selector or the play buttons.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.

prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-directional-pad
elements.description:
A directional pad (D-Pad) component can be used to control the position and
rotation of the map. The D-Pad provides eight directions of movement, a small
compass which indicates the current orientation of the map and a slider for
rotating the map.

It is also possible to disable the map's rotation controls or change the size
of the component.

The Directional Pad component is not supported in 3D.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.

prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-directions
elements.description:
The Directions component provides a way to calculate directions, between two or more input locations with a [RouteLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-RouteLayer.html), using ArcGIS Online and custom Network Analysis Route services.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `getDirections(): Promise<__esri.RouteLayerSolveResult>`
- `save(): Promise<__esri.PortalItem>`
- `saveAs(portalItem: __esri.PortalItem, options: { folder: __esri.PortalFolder; }): Promise<__esri.PortalItem>`
- `zoomToRoute(): Promise<void>`

elements.name: arcgis-direct-line-measurement-3d
elements.description:
The Direct Line Measurement 3D component can be added to a [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/)
component to calculate and display vertical, horizontal, and direct distances between two points.

[![measurement-line-3d](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/3D_DirectLineMeasurement_widget.png)](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/measurement-3d/)

How distances are computed depends on the scene's spatial reference.

In **geographic coordinate systems** (GCS) and in **Web Mercator**:
- Direct distance is computed in a Euclidean manner, in an [ECEF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECEF) coordinate system (or equivalent on other planets);
- Horizontal distance is computed geodetically, taking into consideration the curvature of the planet;
- Vertical distance is computed as an elevation difference.

In **projected coordinate systems** (PCS), apart from Web Mercator, all three distances (direct, horizontal, and vertical)
 are computed in a Euclidean manner (in their respective PCS).

Direct Line Measurement 3D component visualizes and labels the direct, horizontal, and vertical distances and displays the same values
in the UI panel. When the distance between the points is greater than 100 kilometers,
the measurement visualization is simplified, and only the horizontal and vertical distances are calculated.
The direct distance option becomes unavailable.

![measurement-line-3d](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/direct-line-measurement-3d.png)

When the component is active, a horizontal "laser" line is drawn which indicates the height at the current mouse position.
This line can help in analyzing the heights of objects relative to each other and the terrain.
A second laser line shows the intersection of the scene with the vertical plane that passes through the checkered line.

**Things to consider**

* Direct Line Measurement 3D is designed to work in the Scene component. For measurements in the [Map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-map/)
component, use [Distance Measurement 2D](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-distance-measurement-2d/).
* Snapping is enabled by default. This can be temporarily disabled by holding the `CTRL` key.
* Layer types currently supported for snapping are:
[FeatureLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-FeatureLayer.html),
[GraphicsLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-GraphicsLayer.html) (except Mesh geometries),
[GeoJSONLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-GeoJSONLayer.html),
[WFSLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-WFSLayer.html),
[CSVLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-CSVLayer.html),
[3D Object SceneLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-SceneLayer.html),
and [BuildingSceneLayer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-layers-BuildingSceneLayer.html).

**See also**

- [DirectLineMeasurementAnalysis](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-DirectLineMeasurementAnalysis.html)
- [Sample - Measurement in 3D](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/measurement-3d/)

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-direct-line-measurement-3d/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-elevation-profile
elements.description:
The Elevation Profile component is used to generate and display an elevation profile from an [input line graphic](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-ElevationProfile.html#input).

**See also**

- [Sample - Elevation Profile component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/elevation-profile/)
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `start(): Promise<void>` - Switches to the "creating" state in which the user can draw a new line.
- `stop(): Promise<void>` - Stops the creation operation.

prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-expand
elements.description:
The Expand component acts as a clickable button for displaying interactive content, most commonly other components.
--

### Events
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `collapse(): Promise<void>`
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `expand(): Promise<void>`
- `toggle(): Promise<void>`

attributes.name: auto-collapse
attributes.description:
Automatically collapses the expand widget instance when the view's
viewpoint updates.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-expand/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: close-on-esc
attributes.description: When true, the Expand widget will close after the Escape key is pressed when the keyboard focus is within its content.

attributes.name: collapse-icon
attributes.description: Calcite icon used to style the Expand button when the [content](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-Expand.html#content) can be collapsed.

attributes.name: collapse-tooltip
attributes.description: Tooltip to display to indicate Expand widget can be collapsed.

attributes.name: expand-icon
attributes.description: Calcite icon used when the widget is collapsed.

attributes.name: expand-tooltip
attributes.description: Tooltip to display to indicate Expand widget can be expanded.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Indicates whether the widget is currently expanded or not.

attributes.name: focus-trap-disabled
attributes.description: Disables focus trapping within the expand component.

attributes.name: focus-trap-enabled

elements.name: arcgis-feature
elements.description:
The Feature component displays a graphic according to its [PopupTemplate](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-PopupTemplate.html). This component is useful in instances where you want to display information about a feature but without the use of a [Popup](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-Popup.html).
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `nextMedia(contentElementIndex: number): Promise<void>` - Paginates to the next [media info](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-popup-content-MediaContent.html#mediaInfos).
- `previousMedia(contentElementIndex: number): Promise<void>` - Paginates to the previous [media info](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-popup-content-MediaContent.html#mediaInfos).
- `setActiveMedia(contentElementIndex: number, mediaInfoIndex: number): Promise<void>` - Paginates to a specified [media info](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-popup-content-MediaContent.html#mediaInfos) object.
For example, you may have [media content](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-popup-content-MediaContent.html#mediaInfos) which contains multiple mediaInfos.
This method allows you to specify the index of the mediaInfos you wish to display.

is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-feature/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-feature-form
elements.description:
### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisSubmit**
- **arcgisValueChange** - Fires when a field value is updated.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `getValues(): Promise<any>` - Returns all of the field values, regardless of update status.
- `submit(): Promise<void>` - Fires the submit event.

elements.name: arcgis-feature-table
elements.description:
The Feature Table component provides an interactive tabular view of each feature's attributes in a feature layer.
--

### Events
- **arcgisCellClick**
- **arcgisCellKeydown**
- **arcgisCellPointerout**
- **arcgisCellPointerover**
- **arcgisColumnReorder**
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisSelectionChange**

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `deleteSelection(showWarningPrompt?: boolean): Promise<void>`
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `exportSelectionToCSV(includeGeometry?: boolean): Promise<void>`
- `findColumn(fieldName: string): Promise<__esri.ActionColumn | __esri.AttachmentsColumn | __esri.Column | __esri.GroupColumn | __esri.RelationshipColumn | nullish>`
- `goToPage(index: number): Promise<void>`
- `hideColumn(fieldName: string): Promise<void>`
- `nextPage(): Promise<void>`
- `previousPage(): Promise<void>`
- `refresh(): Promise<void>`
- `scrollToBottom(): Promise<void>`
- `scrollToIndex(index: number): Promise<void>`
- `scrollToLeft(): Promise<void>`
- `scrollToRow(objectId: number): Promise<void>`
- `scrollToTop(): Promise<void>`
- `showAllColumns(): Promise<void>`
- `showColumn(fieldName: string): Promise<void>`
- `sortColumn(path: string, direction: "asc" | "desc"): Promise<void>`
- `zoomToSelection(): Promise<void>`

attributes.name: attachments-enabled
attributes.description: Indicates whether to display the `Attachments` field in the table.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-feature-table/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: auto-refresh-disabled
attributes.description: Indicates whether the table should automatically refresh when the underlying data changes

attributes.name: column-performance-mode-disabled
attributes.description:
Indicates whether to enable the table's column performance mode.
This mode is designed to improve the performance of the table when working with a large number of columns.

attributes.name: column-reordering-disabled
attributes.description: Indicates whether the table should allow reordering of columns.

The SQL where clause used to filter features visible in the table.

Text displayed in the table header, under the title.

attributes.description: Indicates whether [editing](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-FeatureTable.html#editing-in-featuretable) is enabled on the data within the feature table.

attributes.name: filter-by-selection-enabled
attributes.description: Indicates whether the table only displays rows that are considered selected.

attributes.name: hide-header

attributes.description: Indicates whether to display layer-specific icons in the layer drop down menu.

attributes.name: hide-menu

attributes.description: Indicates whether to display the Clear selection menu item.

attributes.name: hide-menu-items-delete-selection

attributes.name: hide-menu-items-refresh-data

attributes.name: hide-menu-items-toggle-columns

attributes.name: hide-menu-items-zoom-to-selection

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisSelect**

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.

prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-features
elements.description:
The Features component allows users to view a feature's popupTemplate content such as attributes, actions, related records, etc., without having to be tied to the [View](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View.html).
--

### Events
- **arcgisClose** - Emitted when the component's close button is clicked.
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisTriggerAction** - Emitted when an action is triggered on the component.

### Methods
- `clear(): Promise<void>`
- `close(): Promise<void>` - Closes the component.
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `fetchFeatures(screenPoint: __esri.FeaturesFetchFeaturesScreenPoint, options?: __esri.FetchFeaturesOptions): Promise<__esri.FetchPopupFeaturesResult>` - Use this method to return feature(s) at a given screen location.
These features are fetched from all of the [layer views](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-layers-LayerView.html).
In order to use this, a layer must already have an associated [PopupTemplate](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-PopupTemplate.html).
This method allows a developer to control how the input location is handled.
- `next(): Promise<__esri.FeaturesViewModel>`
- `open(options?: __esri.FeaturesOpenOptions): Promise<void>` - Opens Features with content defined either explicitly or driven from the [PopupTemplate](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-PopupTemplate.html) of input features.
- `previous(): Promise<__esri.FeaturesViewModel>`
- `triggerAction(actionIndex: number): Promise<void>`

attributes.name: active

elements.name: arcgis-fullscreen
elements.description:
The Fullscreen component allows users to toggle the map or scene to fullscreen mode.
Use the escape key (`esc`) to exit fullscreen mode.

**Known limitations**

* The Fullscreen widget only works with browsers that implement the [Fullscreen](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fullscreen_API) API.
  Thus, iOS Safari is not supported.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

elements.name: arcgis-grid-controls
elements.description:
The Grid Controls component provides a user interface (UI) for configuring and displaying a two-dimensional grid.
The grid displayed provides a network of horizontal and vertical lines used to divide the view into equal cells.
With support for snapping, the grid lines can be used as a reference when drawing features.
Note: grid controls are embedded in snapping controls for Sketch and Editor by default.

**Known limitations**

- Grid Controls is only supported in a 2D Map component.
- The grid spacing does not correspond to real world measurements. Distortion will be minimized when used in conjunction with an equal area basemap.
- The grid spacing input will be hidden when working with Web Mercator and Geographic Coordinate Systems.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `trySetDisplayEnabled(enabled: boolean): void` - Call this to turn the grid on/off.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-grid-controls/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: custom-color
attributes.description: The custom color used for drawing the grid, if any.

attributes.name: dynamic-scaling
attributes.description:
Returns `true` if the grid is set to scale dynamically. When dynamic scaling is enabled,
grid cells are added or removed to ensure that grid cells are a reasonable size on screen as the user zooms.
The way additional grid lines are shown is controlled by the [majorLineInterval](#majorLineInterval) property.

attributes.name: effective-spacing-after-dynamic-scaling
attributes.description: Returns the actual spacing of grid lines after dynamic scaling has been applied at the current scale.

attributes.name: grid-color
attributes.description: Controls the color of the major grid lines. Minor grid lines are a slightly transparent version of this color.

attributes.name: grid-out-of-scale
attributes.description:
True if the grid is currently not displayed (and therefore also not a valid snap target),
because [dynamicScaling](#dynamicScaling) is off and the grid cells are too small
to render at the current scale.

attributes.name: hide-color-selection
attributes.description: Controls display of the color and theme selection options.

attributes.name: hide-dynamic-scale-toggle
attributes.description:
Controls display of the dynamic scaling toggle. Dynamic scaling adjusts the size of the grid to work
well regardless of view scale.

attributes.name: hide-grid-enabled-toggle
attributes.description: Controls display of the grid enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid is displayed.

attributes.name: hide-grid-snap-enabled-toggle
attributes.description: Controls display of the grid snapping enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether snapping is enabled.

attributes.name: hide-line-interval-input
attributes.description: Controls display of the line interval input field for setting the interval between major grid lines.

attributes.name: hide-numeric-inputs
attributes.description: Controls display of the numeric input fields for setting grid spacing and rotation.

attributes.name: hide-out-of-scale-warning
attributes.description:
Controls display of the out of scale warning. This warning is displayed when the grid is not shown
because it would be too small at the current scale and dynamic scaling is disabled.

attributes.name: hide-placement-buttons
attributes.description:
Controls display of the grid placement buttons. These buttons allow the user to start interactive
configuration of the grid.

attributes.name: hide-rotate-with-map-toggle
attributes.description: Controls display of the rotate with map toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid rotates with the map.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Icon which represents the component.
Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

attributes.name: interactive-placement-state
attributes.description:
Sets the interactive placement state, either starting or ending a draw operation that implicitly adjusts the grid.
Interactive placement allows the user to define the center of the grid, then the scale and rotation of the grid by
drawing a second point. Setting this to "place" allows the user to move the grid center only. Setting this to "rotate"
keeps the scale and center of the grid constant while rotating the grid by defining a second point.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The component's default label.

attributes.name: major-line-interval
attributes.description:
Controls the number of grid cells shown between major grid lines. Can be anything between 1 and 15.
No minor grid lines are shown when this is set to 1.

attributes.name: placement-disabled
attributes.description:
Use this property to disable the interactive grid placement buttons as needed.
An example use case might be to block interaction while another interactive operation
(e.g. sketching) is in progress.

attributes.name: reference-element
attributes.description: By assigning the `id` attribute of the Map or Scene component to this property, you can position a child component anywhere in the DOM while still maintaining a connection to the Map or Scene.

attributes.name: rotate-with-map
attributes.description: Controls whether the grid rotates with the map, or stays fixed to the screen.

attributes.name: rotation
attributes.description: Rotation of the grid in radians. NOTE: UI controls convert to and from degrees automatically.

attributes.name: snapping-enabled
attributes.description:
Controls snapping behavior if [snappingOptions](#snappingOptions) has been defined.
If [snappingOptions](#snappingOptions) have been defined, disabling or enabling grid snapping will
also disable or enable grid display.

attributes.name: spacing
attributes.description: Length of a grid cell. Grid cells are always square. Defined in [unit](#unit).

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description:
The color scheme used to display the grid. This will be light, dark, or custom. When theme is set to custom,
the [customColor](#customColor) is shown, otherwise a default light or dark theme color is used.

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description:
Unit of measure (foot, meter, etc) used when defining the [spacing](#spacing) grid cell.
Note that units are defined relatively to the map's spatial reference length unit,
which will not correspond to geographic distance unless using a special-purpose basemap
within a supported target area.

When using Web Mercator, the projection defines the length of a meter in projection system units;
this length is equal to a geographic meter only at the equator. On screen, the size of the grid cells is constant
from the equator to the poles, but the real-world size of the grid cell is much larger further from the equator.

The length of the grid cells can usefully correspond to a geographic length when the Grid is used with an
appropriate spatial reference (for example a local system or a State Plane system) within the reference's area of interest.

events.name: arcgisPropertyChange
events.description: Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.

events.name: arcgisReady
events.description: Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

properties.name: autoDestroyDisabled
properties.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-grid-controls/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

properties.name: customColor
properties.description: The custom color used for drawing the grid, if any.

properties.name: displayEnabled
properties.description:
Returns `true` if the grid is enabled for display.
Use [trySetDisplayEnabled](#trySetDisplayEnabled) to enable or disable grid display.

properties.name: dynamicScaling
properties.description:
Returns `true` if the grid is set to scale dynamically. When dynamic scaling is enabled,
grid cells are added or removed to ensure that grid cells are a reasonable size on screen as the user zooms.
The way additional grid lines are shown is controlled by the [majorLineInterval](#majorLineInterval) property.

properties.name: effectiveSpacingAfterDynamicScaling
properties.description: Returns the actual spacing of grid lines after dynamic scaling has been applied at the current scale.

properties.name: gridColor
properties.description: Controls the color of the major grid lines. Minor grid lines are a slightly transparent version of this color.

properties.name: gridControlsEnabled
properties.description: Returns `true` if the grid is in a valid state for manually setting grid properties or starting an interactive placement.

properties.name: gridOutOfScale
properties.description:
True if the grid is currently not displayed (and therefore also not a valid snap target),
because [dynamicScaling](#dynamicScaling) is off and the grid cells are too small
to render at the current scale.

properties.name: hideColorSelection
properties.description: Controls display of the color and theme selection options.

properties.name: hideDynamicScaleToggle
properties.description:
Controls display of the dynamic scaling toggle. Dynamic scaling adjusts the size of the grid to work
well regardless of view scale.

properties.name: hideGridEnabledToggle
properties.description: Controls display of the grid enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid is displayed.

properties.name: hideGridSnapEnabledToggle
properties.description: Controls display of the grid snapping enabled toggle. This toggle controls whether snapping is enabled.

properties.name: hideLineIntervalInput
properties.description: Controls display of the line interval input field for setting the interval between major grid lines.

properties.name: hideNumericInputs
properties.description: Controls display of the numeric input fields for setting grid spacing and rotation.

properties.name: hideOutOfScaleWarning
properties.description:
Controls display of the out of scale warning. This warning is displayed when the grid is not shown
because it would be too small at the current scale and dynamic scaling is disabled.

properties.name: hidePlacementButtons
properties.description:
Controls display of the grid placement buttons. These buttons allow the user to start interactive
configuration of the grid.

properties.name: hideRotateWithMapToggle
properties.description: Controls display of the rotate with map toggle. This toggle controls whether the grid rotates with the map.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Icon which represents the component.
Typically used when the component is controlled by another component (e.g. by the Expand component).

properties.name: interactivePlacementState
properties.description:
Sets the interactive placement state, either starting or ending a draw operation that implicitly adjusts the grid.
Interactive placement allows the user to define the center of the grid, then the scale and rotation of the grid by
drawing a second point. Setting this to "place" allows the user to move the grid center only. Setting this to "rotate"
keeps the scale and center of the grid constant while rotating the grid by defining a second point.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The component's default label.

properties.name: majorLineInterval
properties.description:
Controls the number of grid cells shown between major grid lines. Can be anything between 1 and 15.
No minor grid lines are shown when this is set to 1.

properties.name: messageOverrides
properties.description:
Replace localized message strings with your own strings.

_**Note**: Individual message keys may change between releases._

properties.name: placementDisabled
properties.description:
Use this property to disable the interactive grid placement buttons as needed.
An example use case might be to block interaction while another interactive operation
(e.g. sketching) is in progress.

properties.name: referenceElement
properties.description: By assigning the `id` attribute of the Map or Scene component to this property, you can position a child component anywhere in the DOM while still maintaining a connection to the Map or Scene.

properties.name: rotateWithMap
properties.description: Controls whether the grid rotates with the map, or stays fixed to the screen.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: Rotation of the grid in radians. NOTE: UI controls convert to and from degrees automatically.

properties.name: snappingEnabled
properties.description:
Controls snapping behavior if [snappingOptions](#snappingOptions) has been defined.
If [snappingOptions](#snappingOptions) have been defined, disabling or enabling grid snapping will
also disable or enable grid display.

properties.name: snappingOptions
properties.description:
The [SnappingOptions](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-interactive-snapping-SnappingOptions.html)
that will be controlled by this component if the snapping toggle is enabled for display.
If SnappingOptions are provided, grid display will be automatically enabled or disabled to match snapping state.

properties.name: spacing
properties.description: Length of a grid cell. Grid cells are always square. Defined in [unit](#unit).

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
The color scheme used to display the grid. This will be light, dark, or custom. When theme is set to custom,
the [customColor](#customColor) is shown, otherwise a default light or dark theme color is used.

properties.name: unit
properties.description:
Unit of measure (foot, meter, etc) used when defining the [spacing](#spacing) grid cell.
Note that units are defined relatively to the map's spatial reference length unit,
which will not correspond to geographic distance unless using a special-purpose basemap
within a supported target area.

When using Web Mercator, the projection defines the length of a meter in projection system units;
this length is equal to a geographic meter only at the equator. On screen, the size of the grid cells is constant
from the equator to the poles, but the real-world size of the grid cell is much larger further from the equator.

The length of the grid cells can usefully correspond to a geographic length when the Grid is used with an
appropriate spatial reference (for example a local system or a State Plane system) within the reference's area of interest.

elements.name: arcgis-home
elements.description:
The Home component is a button that navigates back to the
initial [Viewpoint](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Viewpoint.html)
or a previously defined `viewpoint`.
--

### Events
- **arcgisGo** - Fires when the go() method is called.
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `cancelGo(): Promise<void>` - This function provides the ability to interrupt and cancel the process
of navigating back to the initial extent.
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `go(): Promise<void>` - Animates the map or scene to its initial Viewpoint or the
value of `viewpoint`.

prevent memory leaks.

properties.name: viewpoint
properties.description:
The [Viewpoint](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Viewpoint.html)
to go to when going "home".
The initial value is determined in a few different ways:

If no referenceElement is provided, the value is `null`.
Once the referenceElement is ready, the initial viewpoint value is the user-defined [Viewpoint](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Viewpoint.html).

elements.name: arcgis-layer-list
elements.description:
The Layer List component provides a way to display a list of layers, and switch on/off their visibility.
--

### Events
- **arcgisClose** - Emitted when the component's close button is clicked.
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisTriggerAction** - Emitted when an action is triggered on the component.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `triggerAction(action: __esri.ActionButton | __esri.ActionToggle, item: __esri.ListItem): Promise<void>`

is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-layer-list/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-line-of-sight
elements.description:
The Line Of Sight component is a 3D analysis tool that allows you to perform
[line of sight visibility analysis](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysis.html)
in a [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/). Visibility between a given observer and multiple target points is calculated against the currently
displayed content in the view, including the ground, integrated meshes, and 3D objects such as buildings or trees.

![line-of-sight](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/assets/img/apiref/widgets/line-of-sight.png)

The analysis results are displayed as colored lines, where areas visible to the observer are
shown green and occluded parts are marked in red. Also, the color of the target points indicates their visibility.
When the line of sight cannot be calculated, it will be displayed with a gray color. This may happen if either
the target or the observer is not in the view.

When creating a new line of sight analysis, the first click in the Scene creates the
[observer](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysisObserver.html)
and subsequent clicks place the [targets](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysisTarget.html).
Both the observer and target points can be moved by dragging. Additionally, the target points can be removed with a right click.

**Known limitation**

Line Of Sight is only supported in a 3D [Scene](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-scene/) component.

**See also**

- [LineOfSightAnalysis](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-analysis-LineOfSightAnalysis.html)
- [Sample - Line of sight component](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/line-of-sight/)
- [Sample - Analysis objects](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/sample-code/analysis-objects/)
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.

### Methods
- `clear(): Promise<void>` - Clear the current analysis results. After calling this method, the user can set a new observer and targets.
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `continue(): Promise<void>` - After [stop()](#stop) was called, this method allows to continue the line of sight analysis and add more targets.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `start(): Promise<void>` - Start a new line of sight analysis.
- `stop(): Promise<void>` - Stop the current placing of line of sight analysis. Any lines added this far are kept  in the view.
Users can still interact with existing targets and the observer, but they cannot place new target points.

prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-link-chart
elements.description:
Loads a [WebLinkChart](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebLinkChart.html) from an [ArcGIS Enterprise portal](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/portal/latest/administer/windows/what-is-portal-for-arcgis-.htm) into a [LinkChartView](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-LinkChartView.html).


Note: Sign in to access the data in this demo, U/P: `viewer01`/`I68VGU^nMurF`
--

### Events
- **arcgisViewChange** - This event is for view related property changes: zoom, scale, center, rotation, extent, camera, viewpoint.
This event will also emit if stationary toggles from true to false.
- **arcgisViewClick** - Fires after a user clicks on the view.
- **arcgisViewDoubleClick** - Fires after double-clicking on the view.
- **arcgisViewDrag** - Fires during a pointer drag on the view.
- **arcgisViewHold** - Fires during a pointer drag on the view.
- **arcgisViewImmediateClick** - Fires right after a user clicks on the view.
- **arcgisViewImmediateDoubleClick** - Is emitted after two consecutive immediate-click events.
- **arcgisViewKeyDown** - Fires after a keyboard key is pressed.
- **arcgisViewKeyUp** - Fires after a keyboard key is pressed.
- **arcgisViewLayerviewCreate** - Fires after each layer in the link chart has a corresponding LayerView created and rendered in the view.
- **arcgisViewLayerviewCreateError** - Fires when an error emits during the creation of a LayerView after a layer has been added to the link chart.
- **arcgisViewLayerviewDestroy** - Fires after a LayerView is destroyed and is no longer rendered in the view.
- **arcgisViewMouseWheel** - Fires when a wheel button of a pointing device (typically a mouse) is scrolled on the view.
- **arcgisViewPointerDown** - Fires after a mouse button is pressed, or a finger touches the display.
- **arcgisViewPointerEnter** - Fires after a mouse cursor enters the view, or a display touch begins.
- **arcgisViewPointerLeave** - Fires after a mouse cursor leaves the view, or a display touch ends.
- **arcgisViewPointerMove** - Fires after the mouse or a finger on the display moves.
- **arcgisViewPointerUp** - Fires after a mouse button is released, or a display touch ends.
- **arcgisViewReadyChange** - This event is for the `ready` property and will be emitted when the view is ready.
This event will also emit if the `map` property is changed.

### Methods
- `addLayer(layer: __esri.Layer | Promise<any>, index?: number): Promise<void>` - **Deprecated**: since 4.33, use `element.map.add(layer)` instead.

Adds a layer to the map layers collection.. 
- `addLayers(layers: __esri.Layer[], index?: number): Promise<void>` - **Deprecated**: since 4.33, use `element.map.addMany([layer])` instead.

Adds a layer or array of layers to the map layers collection.. 
- `closePopup(): Promise<void>` - Closes the popup.
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Destroys the view, and any associated resources, including its map, popup, and UI elements.
- `goTo(target: __esri.GoToTarget2D, options?: __esri.GoToOptions2D): Promise<unknown>` - Sets the view to a given target.
- `openPopup(options?: __esri.PopupViewOpenPopupOptions): Promise<void>` - Opens the popup at the given location with content defined either explicitly with content or driven
from the PopupTemplate of input features.
- `toMap(screenPoint: __esri.MapViewScreenPoint | MouseEvent): __esri.Point`
- `toScreen(point: __esri.Point, options?: __esri.ToScreenOptions2D): __esri.MapViewScreenPoint | nullish`
- `tryFatalErrorRecovery(): Promise<void>` - Call this method to clear any fatal errors resulting from a lost WebGL context.
- `viewOnReady(callback?: (): void, errback?: (error: Error) => void): Promise<void>` - `viewOnReady()` may be leveraged once an instance of the component and its underlying [view](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart/#view) is created and ready.
This method takes two input parameters, a `callback` function and an `errback` function, and returns a promise. The `callback` executes when the promise resolves, and the `errback` executes if the promise is rejected.
- `whenLayerView(layer: __esri.Layer): Promise<__esri.LayerView>` - Gets the LayerView created on the view for the given layer.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

attributes.name: basemap
attributes.description:
Specifies a basemap for the link chart. The basemap is only visible when the link
chart is set to a geographic layout. See
[documentation on layouts](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/knowledge/latest/knowledge-studio/change-the-layout-applied-to-a-link-chart.htm)
for more detail. The basemap is a set of layers that give
geographic context to the LinkChartView and the other operational layers
in the link chart.

attributes.name: center
attributes.description:
Represents the view's center point; when setting the center, you may pass a
esri/geometry/Point instance or a string representing
a longitude/latitude pair (`"-100.4593, 36.9014"`).
Setting the center immediately changes the current view.
For animating the view, see this component's goTo() method.

attributes.name: display-filter-disabled
attributes.description:
Indicates whether layer's displayFilter are honored when rendering layers in the view.
If `false`, display filters are ignored and all features are rendered.

attributes.name: item-id
attributes.description:
The ID of a WebLinkChart from an ArcGIS Enterprise portal.

To configure the portal url you must set the [`portalUrl` property on `config`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-config.html#portalUrl) before the Link Chart component loads.

attributes.name: popup-disabled
attributes.description: Controls whether the popup opens when users click on the view.

attributes.name: resize-align
attributes.description:
Defines which anchor stays still while resizing the browser window. The default, `center`,
ensures the view's center point remains constantly visible as the window size changes. The other
options allow  the respective portion of the view to remain visible when the window's size is changed.

attributes.name: rotation
attributes.description:
The clockwise rotation of due north in relation to the top of the view in degrees.
The view may be rotated by directly setting
the rotation or by using the following mouse event: `Right-click + Drag`.
WebLinkChart rotation may be disabled by setting the `rotationEnabled` property
in [constraints](#constraints) to `false`.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description:
Represents the link chart scale at the center of the view. Setting the scale immediately changes the view. For animating
the view, see this component's goTo() method.

attributes.name: suspended
attributes.description: Indicates if the view is visible on the page.

attributes.name: time-zone
attributes.description:
Defines the time zone of the view.
The time zone property determines how dates and times are represented to the user,
but the underlying data is unchanged.

attributes.name: zoom
attributes.description:
Represents the level of detail (LOD) at the center of the view.
A zoom level (or scale) is a number that defines how large or small the contents of a link chart appear in a link chart view.
Zoom level is a number usually between 0 (global view) and 23 (very detailed view) and is used as a shorthand for predetermined scale values.
A value of -1 means the view has no LODs.
When setting the zoom value, the LinkChartView converts it to the corresponding scale, or interpolates it if the zoom is a fractional number.
LinkChartView can display link charts with different projections at a full range of scales, and so use the scale property on this component rather than zoom level.

Setting the zoom immediately changes the current view. For animating the view, see this component's goTo() method.
Setting this property in conjunction with `center` is a convenient way to set the initial extent of the view.

properties.name: allLayerViews
properties.description:
Collection containing a flat list of all the created LayerViews
related to the basemap, operational layers, and group layers in this view.

properties.name: autoDestroyDisabled
properties.description:
If true, the component will not be destroyed automatically when it is
disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

properties.name: background
properties.description:
The background color of the LinkChartView. If the view's link chart changes, the view's `background` is reset to the link chart's background,
even if the user set it previously.

properties.name: basemap
properties.description:
Specifies a basemap for the link chart. The basemap is only visible when the link
chart is set to a geographic layout. See
[documentation on layouts](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/knowledge/latest/knowledge-studio/change-the-layout-applied-to-a-link-chart.htm)
for more detail. The basemap is a set of layers that give
geographic context to the LinkChartView and the other operational layers
in the link chart.

properties.name: basemapView
properties.description: Represents the view for a single basemap after it has been added to the link chart.

properties.name: center
properties.description:
Represents the view's center point; when setting the center, you may pass a
esri/geometry/Point instance or a string representing
a longitude/latitude pair (`"-100.4593, 36.9014"`).
Setting the center immediately changes the current view.
For animating the view, see this component's goTo() method.

properties.name: constraints
properties.description: Specifies constraints to scale, zoom, and rotation that may be applied to the LinkChartView.

properties.name: displayFilterDisabled
properties.description:
Indicates whether layer's displayFilter are honored when rendering layers in the view.
If `false`, display filters are ignored and all features are rendered.

properties.name: extent
properties.description:
The extent represents the visible portion of a link chart within the view as an instance of
[Extent](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-geometry-Extent.html).
Setting the extent immediately changes the view without animation. To animate
the view, see this component's goTo() method.
When the view is rotated, the extent does not update to include the newly visible portions of the link chart.

properties.name: fatalError
properties.description: A rejected view indicates a fatal error making it unable to display.

properties.name: graphics
properties.description: Allows for adding graphics directly to the default graphics in the View.

properties.name: highlights
properties.description:
The highlights property is a collection of HighlightGroup objects that
allow you to visually emphasize specific features on the link chart.

properties.name: interacting
properties.description: Indication whether the view is being interacted with (for example when panning or by an interactive tool).

properties.name: itemId
properties.description:
The ID of a WebLinkChart from an ArcGIS Enterprise portal.

To configure the portal url you must set the [`portalUrl` property on `config`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-config.html#portalUrl) before the Link Chart component loads.

properties.name: layerViews
properties.description:
A collection containing a hierarchical list of all the created
[LayerViews](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-layers-LayerView.html) of the
[operational layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebLinkChart.html#layers) in the link chart.

properties.name: magnifier
properties.description: The magnifier allows for showing a portion of the view as a magnifier image on top of the view.

properties.name: map
properties.description:
An instance of a [WebLinkChart](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-WebLinkChart.html)
object to display in the view.

properties.name: navigating
properties.description: Indication whether the view is being navigated (for example when panning).

properties.name: navigation
properties.description: Options to configure the navigation behavior of the View.

properties.name: padding
properties.description:
Use the padding property to make the [center](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#center),
and [extent](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-MapView.html#extent), etc.

properties.name: popup
properties.description:
A [Popup](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-widgets-Popup.html) object that displays general content or attributes from
[layers](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#layers) in the [map](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#map).

[Read more...](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-views-View2D.html#popup)

properties.name: popupDisabled
properties.description: Controls whether the popup opens when users click on the view.

properties.name: ready
properties.description:
When `true`, this property indicates whether the view successfully satisfied all dependencies,
signaling that the following conditions are met.

properties.name: resizeAlign
properties.description:
Defines which anchor stays still while resizing the browser window. The default, `center`,
ensures the view's center point remains constantly visible as the window size changes. The other
options allow  the respective portion of the view to remain visible when the window's size is changed.

properties.name: resolution
properties.description:
Represents the current value of one pixel in the unit of the view's spatialReference.
The value of resolution is calculated by dividing the view's extent width
by its width.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description:
The clockwise rotation of due north in relation to the top of the view in degrees.
The view may be rotated by directly setting
the rotation or by using the following mouse event: `Right-click + Drag`.
WebLinkChart rotation may be disabled by setting the `rotationEnabled` property
in [constraints](#constraints) to `false`.

properties.name: scale
properties.description:
Represents the link chart scale at the center of the view. Setting the scale immediately changes the view. For animating
the view, see this component's goTo() method.

properties.name: spatialReference
properties.description:
The spatial reference of the view.
This indicates the projected or geographic coordinate system used
to locate geographic features in the link chart.

properties.name: stationary
properties.description: Indication whether the view is animating, being navigated with or resizing.

properties.name: suspended
properties.description: Indicates if the view is visible on the page.

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
This property specifies the base colors used by some widgets
and components to render graphics and labels.

properties.name: timeExtent
properties.description:
The view's time extent. Time-aware layers display their temporal data that falls within
the view's time extent. Setting the view's time extent is similar to setting the spatial
extent because once the time extent is set, the
view updates automatically to conform to the change.

properties.name: timeZone
properties.description:
Defines the time zone of the view.
The time zone property determines how dates and times are represented to the user,
but the underlying data is unchanged.

properties.name: updating
properties.description:
Indicates whether the view is being updated by additional data requests to the network,
or by processing received data.

properties.name: view
properties.description: Internal view of the component.

properties.name: viewpoint
properties.description:
Represents the current view as a Viewpoint or point of observation on the view.
Setting the viewpoint immediately changes the current view. For animating
the view, see this component's goTo() method.

properties.name: zoom
properties.description:
Represents the level of detail (LOD) at the center of the view.
A zoom level (or scale) is a number that defines how large or small the contents of a link chart appear in a link chart view.
Zoom level is a number usually between 0 (global view) and 23 (very detailed view) and is used as a shorthand for predetermined scale values.
A value of -1 means the view has no LODs.
When setting the zoom value, the LinkChartView converts it to the corresponding scale, or interpolates it if the zoom is a fractional number.
LinkChartView can display link charts with different projections at a full range of scales, and so use the scale property on this component rather than zoom level.

Setting the zoom immediately changes the current view. For animating the view, see this component's goTo() method.
Setting this property in conjunction with `center` is a convenient way to set the initial extent of the view.

This event will also emit if stationary toggles from true to false.

elements.name: arcgis-link-chart-layout-switcher
elements.description:
A component for use in link charts that allows users to switch between different layouts. See [documentation on layouts](https://enterprise.arcgis.com/en/knowledge/latest/knowledge-studio/change-the-layout-applied-to-a-link-chart.htm) for more details.


Note: Sign in to access the data in this demo, U/P: `viewer01`/`I68VGU^nMurF`
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.
- **arcgisReady** - Emitted when the component associated with a map or scene view is is ready to be interacted with.
- **arcgisSwitchLayout** - Fires when component has completed the layout switch

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `switchLayout(newLayout: "basic-grid" | "chronological-mono-timeline" | "chronological-multi-timeline" | "geographic-organic-standard" | "hierarchical-bottom-to-top" | "organic-community" | "organic-standard" | "radial-root-centric" | "tree-left-to-right"): Promise<void>` - Switches the layout of the link chart to the value provided.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The appearance of the layout switcher. `dropdown` displays a button that is clicked to reveal a dropdown menu, while `menu-bar` displays a menu bar.

attributes.name: auto-destroy-disabled
attributes.description:

disconnected from the document. This is useful when you want to move the
component to a different place on the page, or temporarily hide it. If this
is set, make sure to call the [destroy](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/references/map-components/arcgis-link-chart-layout-switcher/#destroy) method when you are done to
prevent memory leaks.

elements.name: arcgis-locate
elements.description:
The Locate component animates the Map or Scene to the user's current location.

This component uses the browser's [Geolocation API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation_API) which is only available in [secure contexts](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Secure_Contexts), such as HTTPS.
Note that localhost is considered "potentially secure" and can be used for easy testing in browsers that support
[Window.isSecureContext](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/isSecureContext#browser_compatibility).
--

### Events

- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Emitted when the value of a property is changed. Use this to listen to changes to properties.

- **arcgisSuccess**

### Methods
- `cancelLocate(): Promise<void>` - This function provides the ability to interrupt and cancel the process of
programmatically obtaining the location of the user's device.
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `locate(): Promise<GeolocationPosition | null>`
